data.title: The 30+ Best Anime On Hulu You Can Start Streaming Today
data.meta_description: The 2010s and beyond have increased the anime genre's global appeal. It was a somewhat limited type of entertainment in earlier decades. It has advanced to the
data.text:
The 2010s and beyond have increased the anime genre’s global appeal. It was a somewhat limited type of entertainment in earlier decades.

It has advanced to the point that every primary streaming service, including Hulu, is acquiring licensing to numerous anime shows to supplement their core collections.

Hulu offers various anime content, including movies and serialized T.V. anime.

Here are 30 List of Anime to watch in HULU

1.) GURREN LAGANN (2007)

Gurren Lagann, created by Gainax, is another outstanding example of an anime-original series. It’s frequently hailed as a contemporary classic by seasoned anime viewers.

Although it is undoubtedly a sci-fi mecha-action anime, the dazzling action and graphics serve as platforms for the surprisingly moving story.

The story of Gurren Lagann begins with Simon and Kamina toiling in the upkeep of their underground colony. At the same time, the terrifying Spiral King rules over all life aboveground and has driven most of humanity beneath.

In particular, Kamina has lofty goals for humanity’s return, but it just scratches the surface of what develops into a compelling and perceptive character-driven tale about willpower.

2.) PSYCHO-PASS (2012)

Psycho-Pass is a unique anime story that offers some of the most compelling sci-fi tales available today. In the Production I.G. animated film Psycho-Pass, the Japanese government imposes a Minority Report-style dictatorship over its populace in a technologically dystopian society.

The government tracks brain biometrics to determine a person’s predisposition for criminality in an authoritarian effort to eradicate all crime.

If they don’t pass this Psycho-Pass, the government won’t hesitate to use immediate lethal action against them. The Japanese government’s cynical enforcers are the main focus of the series up until a rookie inspector with high aspirations for justice starts to stir things up.

Psycho-Pass has received plaudits for drawing inspiration from Ridley Scott’s cyberpunk classic Blade Runner and the Steven Spielberg movie.

3.) DRAGON BALL (1986)

The first series of Dragon Ball, created by Akira Toriyama, doesn’t get enough credit for the franchise’s subsequent explosion into a global multimedia powerhouse.

Dragon Ball Z was undoubtedly a new high point, but the original Dragon Ball is still a classic shounen anime.

Son Goku begins this franchise launch pad as a fish out of water who doesn’t recognize his strength while encountering a diverse cast of heroes and villains along the road.

Dragon Ball includes well-known antagonists like the Red Ribbon Army and King Piccolo’s adversarial past before becoming a hero.

4.) KILL LA KILL (2013)

Kill la Kill, created by the same studio that made Cyberpunk: Edgerunners, is still one of Trigger’s most recognizable works. The chic character designs, lively colour scheme, and exciting action-focused animation are instantly recognised.

A rebellious schoolgirl’s quest to identify her father’s killer and exact revenge are the central themes of Kill la Kill, putting all those elements on show.

She runs afoul of Satsuki Kiryuin, the Honnouji Academy student council president and Kiryuin’s intimidating, fashion-empire-heading mother. So it makes sense that a lot of the action centers around the individuals’ apparent sentience-infused clothing, which has given them abilities.

5.) BLEACH (2004)

After the initial series’ popularity waned, Bleach—one of the anime and manga series considered Weekly Shounen Jump’s “Big Three” alongside Naruto and One Piece—is set to make a triumphant comeback. Unfortunately, because of this, the anime adaptation could never complete the original work’s plot.

However, with the release of Bleach: Thousand-Year Blood War, this will no longer be the case.

The build-up to the Quincy Blood War is the main subject of this new season/successor series, which continues where the first one left off.

Ichigo and his friends are in a difficult predicament because to end the Wandenreich revolt, he and his comrades in the Soul Society must forge an odd alliance with their old rivals from Hueco Mundo.

This Quincy family secret organization is to exact revenge on the Soul Reapers, who came dangerously close to putting them out of business years ago.

6.) MY HERO ACADEMIA (2016)

The superhero genre has gained widespread appeal because of the shounen smash My Hero Academia.

The plot centers on Izuku Midoriya, also known as Deku, who is initially born without a Quirk (the show’s term for powers) despite 80% of the population having one.

These abilities also reveal the characteristics of the user. Nevertheless, Deku persists still and enrols at the esteemed U.A. superhero academy. Senior High. When Season 6 of U.A. debuts on Hulu on October 1, it will rapidly wrap up some unfinished business from Season 5 before setting up the show’s climactic battle between its heroes.

The bad guys of the Paranormal Liberation Front, led by Tomura Shigaraki, are in high school.

7.) SPY X FAMILY (2022)

Spy x Family, an adaptation of Tatsuya Endo’s manga that swept the anime landscape earlier this year, was a pleasant and wholesome addition to the television schedule for 2022.

As he is dispatched on a top-secret diplomatic mission abroad, the elite spy, only known by the codename Agent Twilight introduces the first episode of the series.

His goal is to prevent a conflict between two strong countries, but for surprising reasons, his undercover operation turns out to be the hardest yet. Twilight adopts the alias Loid with Anya and Yor to form the Forger family.

Each family member has information about their duties and skills that they want to keep a secret from the others.

Similar: 31+ Wholesome MANGA Series That Will Put You At Ease

8.) CHAINSAW MAN (2022)

Tatsuki Fujimoto’s Chainsaw Man, one of the best shounen manga to be published recently, is now getting an anime adaptation.

Chainsaw Man is an animated film produced by the incredibly talented animation studio MAPPA, known for such films as Jujutsu Kaisen and Attack on Titan: The Final Season.

It tells the tale of the tragically orphaned young man Denji and how his life changes because of the supernatural creatures that inhabit this world.

Denji’s best buddy and the canine devil, Pochita, saves his life when the local Yakuza eventually turns against him, forcing him to do the dirty job of the organization as compensation for his father’s passing.

Denji now functions as the Chainsaw Devil and joins the Japanese government’s devil-hunting organization.

9.) MOB PSYCHO 100 (2016)

Mob Psycho 100 is the latest work by author ONE, who is well known for the critically acclaimed superhero and shounen spoof One-Punch Man. The story of the mild-mannered Shigeo Kageyama, better known as Mob, is followed in Mob Psycho 100.

It’s an adaptation of the novel by seasoned studio Bones into an anime format that has received equal praise for its qualities in its first two seasons.

Mob is an esper with extraordinary psychic abilities who prefers to keep them to himself to lead an everyday life. However, Mob runs into several issues that push his control and patience to severe tests, along with his self-described psychic friend and mentor, Reigen.

10.) FATE/ ZERO (2011)

Fate/Zero is an action and fantasy series that is a spin-off of the well-known light book series by Gen Urobuchi that takes place before the events of Fate/Stay Night.

The Fourth Holy Grail War is a covert competition in which seven Masters call upon the legendary souls of victors throughout history. The anime depicts the events of this battle.

The Holy Grail, a magical chalice that grants the winner’s wishes, is the prize in this bloody fight royale between these warriors. The main character of Fate/Zero, deadly assassin Kiritsugu Emiya, fights for the Einzberns, his wife’s family, in the Fourth Holy Grail War.

11.) ERASED (2016)

The anime adaptation of Kei Sanbe’s novel Erased by A-1 Pictures delivers a gripping mystery tale in a contemporary setting that is both grounded and mystical.

Satoru Fujinuma is a young man in his 20s who works at a pizzeria while he tries to launch a career as a manga artist. However, he possesses an exceptional talent called Revival that enables him to go back in time just before a catastrophe occurs, allowing him to stop it.

After an unknown assailant brutally murders Satoru’s mother, Satoru returns to his early years to try to save her life there.

12.) HUNTER X HUNTER (2011)

Based on the renowned shounen manga Hunter x Hunter by author Yoshihiro Togashi, animation company Madhouse created a new and enhanced T.V. series.

Hunter x Hunter is a vast, vibrant, modern fantasy with many world-building and intriguing characters from the same creator who gave fans Yu Yu Hakusho.

The young Gon Freecs plans to follow in the footsteps of his father, who abandoned him by becoming a world-class hunter specializing in locating uncommon objects, creatures, or locations.

Gon teams up with his friends and allies Killua, Kurapika, and Leorio on a world-trotting journey full of supernatural dangers and bright new realms after passing the test to obtain his license.

13.) LUPIN III: THE FIRST (2019)

Since the original manga by Monkey Punch was published in the 1960s, Lupin the Third has appeared in a variety of media, making him one of the recognizable names in the anime business.

The 2019 Lupin III: The First adaptation of the colorful heist adventures of the titular Arsène Lupin III follows Lupin and his crew of professional thieves.

They travel to France and Brazil in search of a treasure that even his legendary grandfather couldn’t find.

The anime adaptations have been exceptionally well received in the film format. Anyone who can crack the mechanical diary’s code contained in the Bresson Diary can locate the treasure, and a Nazi treasure-hunting team is also after them.

14.) HELLSING (2006)

The second anime adaptation of the cult favourite dark fantasy horror manga by Kouta Hirano is the ten-episode Hellsing Ultimate series.

While the previous anime series diverged into a unique narrative that was only loosely based on the source material, Ultimate stays more faithful to the original story.

The Hellsing Organization has been Britain’s finest line of defense against the undead in a world where they regularly threaten the living. Alucard, the organization’s most potent weapon, is left to Sir Integra Hellsing, the group’s head.

An uncommon type of undead warrior who supports the living is the vampire. A brutal battle between the squad and rival monster-hunting groups and the undead eventually breaks out.

Related: 30+ Anime Characters Who are Gun Wielders You Should Get To Know!

15.) CLAYMORE (2007)

Claymore, a dark fantasy series by Norihiro Yagi, was turned into a 26-episode anime series by the animation studio Madhouse.

The story is set in a fantastical Middle Ages when Yoma, demonic animals, terrorize the last of the human race. Due to these creatures’ ravenous appetites for human flesh, Claymores—human-Yoma hybrids explicitly made to eliminate this threat—arose.

Raki’s life is saved when the Claymore named Clare appears and dispatches the monsters in his town. Raki, however, is quickly expelled from the community and decides to accompany Clare on her journey to purge the Earth of any Yoma she encounters.

16.) DRAGON BALL SUPER (2015)

One of the most recognizable anime franchises in the world is the Dragon Ball series by Akira Toriyama.

The eagerly anticipated Z sequel series, Dragon Ball Super, features Goku and crew leading relatively quiet lives following their epic battle with Majin Boo. However, the ensemble is dragged back into a life of high-octane action when the God of Destruction, Beerus.

He descends to Earth to test the strength of its most challenging adversaries.

From there, the plot develops into a grand journey that sees the Z Fighters encountering new solid allies and enemies while traversing several timelines.

17.) MUSHI-SHI (2005)

Mushi-shi is a contemplative animation in a fantasy version of this magically realistic reality. The world is inhabited by spiritual beings known as Mushi, who are generally calm and unconcerned by humankind’s conflicts on Earth.

Mushi masters are tasked with hunting out these hard-to-sense beings to study and understand them. Here comes the eponymous master Ginko, whose anthology-style adventures lead him across the countryside while he meets people and engages with the Mushi.

18.) AKIRA (1988)

Akira is one of the anime films, along with others like Ghost in the Shell, that contributed to the genre’s transformation and made people everywhere notice what animation was developing into.

A pair of childhood friends in a Neo-Tokyo motorcycle gang live their lives evading the constant fear of military occupation and War in a dystopian sci-fi future.

Tetsuo Shima, one of the boys, develops terrifying telekinetic abilities that endanger the city and the entire globe. It’s a thrilling, gut-wrenching, and provocative sci-fi thriller that pays homage to films like Blade Runner.

19.) STEINS; GATE (2011)

Steins; Gate is a sci-fi thriller based on the same-named visual novel video game. Rintaro Okabe, a self-described lunatic scientist, has concocted fantasies about foiling a covert, well-organized conspiracy.

The group delves into the enigma behind time travel together with Rintaro’s diverse cast of adoring friends. Makise Kurisu gets involved, though, and a more sinister mystery comes to light.

20.) ATTACK ON TITAN (2013)

For more than a decade, Attack on Titan has been among the most-watched anime shows. Additionally, Hulu is releasing new episodes of the final season the same week they are released in Japan.

The series takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where people have built walls around their towns to protect them from the Titans, a race of enormous humanoids with a voracious taste for destruction.

Eren Jaeger joins the Survey Corps to battle the Titans after losing his mother to them when he was a young boy. In addition to allowing humanity to fight back, Eren discovering his potential to turn into a Titan reveals some of the Titans’ well-kept secrets.

21.) PLATINUM END (2021)

God is ready to retire in Platinum End, and we need someone to fill the Almighty’s void. Enter Mirai Kakehashi, a high school student who is contemplating suicide but is stopped from doing so by Nasse, a Guardian Angel.

In addition to saving Mirai’s life, Nasse shows him exceptional skills and declares him to be one of the contenders to succeed in God. Sadly, not all other God candidates are as honorable as Mirai, and some are ready to kill anyone.

22.) FAIRY GONE (2019)

Until the War of Unification, Fairy Gone had several kingdoms. Since then, a young lady named Mariya has been hired by Dorothea, a government organization established to capture Fairy Soldiers who have turned rogue.

These males and females had magical organs implanted into them so they could be more potent during the conflict.

Mariya is personally involved since Veronica, one of her closest childhood friends is now a rogue Fairy Soldier working for an unidentified organization.

Related: 31+ Of The Greatest Magic Anime Series (Recommended)

23.) INITIAL D (1998)

Street racing was first introduced to anime by Initial D before The Fast and the Furious. Takumi Fujiwara, a local delivery boy whose driving prowess swiftly draws the attention of the underground racing scene, is the protagonist of the television series.

Takumi finds himself suddenly the target of other racers who want to be the one to beat him after unexpectedly winning a race against one of the top competitors. Takumi is pushed to his limits by every opponent as his abilities develop.

24.) HORIMIYA (2021)

We follow Hori and Miyamura in Horimiya. One of the famous females at school, Hori, also portrays that popularity through her attire. At home, though, she must dress casually and eke out an existence while caring for her younger brother.

To keep her grade-A position, Hori makes every effort to keep this information from her peers. That is, until Hori’s goth friend Miyamura, who she avoids at school, learns about her private life.

The two students, who were formerly rivals, now confide in one another.

Relevant: 26+ Of The Best Romance Anime Of All Time!

25.) KAGUYA-SAMA: LOVE IS WAR (2019)

Love is War is a celebrated anime rom-com that centers on Kaguya Shinomiya and Miyuki Shirogane, two Shuchiin Academy students who are in love. However, it turns out that neither of them is eager to reveal their romantic secrets.

The class-act students, who are both too arrogant and famous, must negotiate the complicated—and occasionally humorous—a world of genuine love while juggling the complexities of academics and busy social life.

26.) BLOOD-C (2011)

Discover Saya Kisaragi, the main character of Blood-C. Saya attends high school and has a group of buddies during the day. Saya, however, takes on the role of a shrine maiden and the guardian of her community at night.

Saya uses a sacred blade to battle the abominable Elder Bairns, thanks to her father, Tadayoshi. However, Saya’s double life is upended when Elder Bairns begin attacking her at school during the day.

Additionally, Saya’s life is centered on a dark secret that could endanger everything she loves and herself.

27.) GATE (2015)

Dragons, fairies, demons, and other creatures don’t belong in our world, according to the Gate anime series, at least not until a portal to another realm unexpectedly appears in Tokyo.

Young Yji Itami is enlisted in the Japan Self-Defense Forces and dispatched on a diplomatic mission to the other world due to his acquaintance with fantasy tropes and subjects.

In the parallel realm, Yji can make new friends and allies, but he also makes new adversaries who could endanger both domains. The “special region” and Earth will be torn apart if Yji cannot discover a solution.

28.) PARASYTE: THE MAXIM (2014)

Shinichi Izumi, a high school student, is forced into the middle of an alien invasion in Parasyte: The Maxim. The parasites, known as Parasytes, generally wholly take over the brains of their hosts.

Instead of embedding in Shinichi’s brain, the parasite does so in his arm. Shinichi allies with his invader as they battle other Parasytes in the city after the Parasyte adopts its own identity and adopts the name Migi.

They could be the only effective line of defense against the invisible invasion of the Parasytes for humanity.

29.) BLACK LAGOON (2006)

The Black Lagoon is a ship that belonged to a gang of mercenaries known as the Lagoon Company in the television series of the same name.

Rokuro Okajima, who was tricked into carrying a pricey disc packed with crucial information, ends up in their orbit when the team takes him hostage.

The mercenaries Dutch, Revy, and Benny all take to Rokuro immediately, which is good news for him.

Rokuro joins the Lagoon Company after demonstrating his worth to them, changes his name to Rock, and starts a new life of exploration.

30.) DANGARONPA: The Animation (2013)

In the anime adaptation of the Danganronpa video games, young Makoto Naegi believed his luck had changed. Makoto learns Hope’s Peak Academy is a sham after being accepted there.

A cruel teacher who only appears to them through his radio-controlled bear, Monobear, has kidnapped him and 14 other students.

The sole option the headmaster gives the students for leaving the school is to murder one of their classmates and escape punishment at the subsequent trial.

Unfortunately for Makoto, several of his classmates are too eager to commit murder.

–
